title: Jakub Dobes Got An Interesting Gift Following Ovechkin’s Record
snippets: Unless you’ve been living under a rock, you know that the Washington Capitals’ captain and super sniper, Alexander Ovechkin, broke Wayne Gretzky’s goal-scoring record this weekend when he beat countryman Ilya Sorokin on a power play. summary: Alexander Ovechkin, captain of the Washington Capitals, set a new NHL goal-scoring record by surpassing Wayne Gretzky's previous record. Ovechkin achieved this milestone during a game against Ilya Sorokin, scoring on a power play. Following his record-breaking goal, an on-ice celebration took place, and Budweiser, an American beer company, planned an additional celebration in honor of Ovechkin's achievement.
titles: Jakub Dobes Got An Interesting Gift Following Ovechkin’s Record

title: Dave & Buster's Interim CEO Says Chain 'Unwinding' Past Mistakes
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Dave & Buster's interim CEO Kevin Sheehan said the company is working to fix past mistakes.
  • Sheehan said past leadership made "very dramatic and chaotic changes." CEO Chris Morris resigned from the gaming restaurant franchise in December to take over as CEO of the retail waxing franchise European Wax Center.
  • Fourth-quarter sales fell short of analysts' estimates.


Dave & Buster's (PLAY) new leadership is looking to correct mistakes made by past executives, interim CEO Kevin Sheehan said on the company's fourth-quarter earnings call.

In attempting "to improve the business that was already doing well, prior leadership made very dramatic and chaotic changes that, among other things, distracted, confused, and overwhelmed our customers and our operators," Sheehan said Monday, according to a transcript from AlphaSense.

The gaming restaurant franchise's previous CEO, Chris Morris, resigned from the top job in December to take over as CEO of the retail waxing franchise European Wax Center (EWCZ). Dave & Buster's shares have fallen 75% over the past year.

Sheehan said he and other new executives have been "systematically unwinding these mistakes and pursuing a back-to-basics strategy while making high-confidence improvements to the key areas of the business."

Q4 Revenue Comes in Shy of Expectation

The company reported fiscal 2024 fourth-quarter revenue of $534.5 million, down 11% year-over-year and below the $545.4 million expected by analysts polled by Visible Alpha. The company posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $0.69, a penny above consensus.

Shares of Dave & Buster's were little changed in recent trading after initially surging Tuesday.
summary: Dave & Buster's interim CEO, Kevin Sheehan, announced efforts to correct previous leadership errors that led to dramatic and chaotic changes, negatively impacting the company and its customers. This comes after former CEO Chris Morris resigned in December to become CEO of European Wax Center. The company's fourth-quarter sales of $534.5 million fell short of the expected $545.4 million, although earnings per share were slightly above expectations at $0.69. Despite these efforts and financial results, Dave & Buster's shares have dropped 75% over the past year.
titles: Dave & Buster's Interim CEO Says Chain 'Unwinding' Past Mistakes

title: Watch These Supermicro Price Levels as Stock Soars After Tariff-Induced Selling
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Super Micro Computer shares jumped in early trading Tuesday, adding to an 11% gain yesterday, as investors bid up the server marker’s stock after a few days of big losses during the broader market sell-off.
  • The stock completed a bullish engulfing pattern in Monday’s trading session, potentially forming a bear trap.
  • Investors should watch major overhead areas on Supermicro's chart around $48 and $63, while also monitoring vital support levels near $26 and $17.


Super Micro Computer (SMCI) shares jumped in early trading Tuesday, adding to an 11% surge yesterday, as investors bid up the server marker’s stock after a few days of big losses during the broader market's tariff-fueled sell-off.

Sentiment surrounding the stock likely received a boost from J.P. Morgan analysts who recently pointed out that the company would only need to increase its global prices by 4%, based on the portion of its hardware that would be affected by tariffs.

Supermicro shares saw significant price swings in both directions during the first quarter as the company dealt with accounting issues that raised concerns of a potential Nasdaq delisting until the company met the exchange’s deadline to file several delayed financial reports in February. The stock was up 6% at around $35 in recent trading.

Below, we break down the technicals on Supermicro’s chart and identify major price levels that investors may be monitoring.

Potential Bear Trap

After gapping lower in late October, Supermicro shares oscillated within an orderly ascending channel until breaking down below the pattern’s lower trendline toward the end of last month.

However, despite falling to its lowest level since early February last week, the stock completed a bullish engulfing pattern in Monday’s trading session, potentially forming a bear trap—a trading event that lures investors to sell upon a breach of major support before the price makes a sudden move higher.

What’s more, Monday’s buying coincided with the relative strength index (RSI) rallying from a reading of around 35, the same level the indicator bottomed at in early February before the stock roughly doubled over a two-week period.

Let’s identify two major overhead areas to watch on Supermicro’s chart amid the potential for follow-through buying, and also point out vital support levels worth monitoring.

Major Overhead Areas to Watch

A decisive close back above the ascending channel’s lower trendline could trigger a rally to around $48. This level, currently just above the closely watched 200-day moving average, connects a range of comparable trading activity on the chart extending back to last year’s prominent August swing low.

Buying above this price could see the stock revisit the $63 area. Investors who have accumulated shares during the stock’s recent decline may decide to lock in profits in this region near a trendline that links last year's late-August peak with the February swing high.

Interestingly, this location also sits in the same vicinity as a projected bars pattern target that takes the stock’s sharp trend higher during February and overlays it from the low of yesterday’s bullish engulfing candle.

Vital Support Levels Worth Monitoring

A breach of the bullish engulfing candle's low could see Supermicro shares initially retrace to around $26, a location on the chart where they may attract support near the January trough and early-November countertrend high.

Finally, a breakdown below this level paves the way for a potential drop to $17. Investors may seek buy-and-hold opportunities in this region near the mid-November trough, which also marks the stock’s 52-week low.

The comments, opinions, and analyses expressed on Investopedia are for informational purposes only. Read our warranty and liability disclaimer for more info.

As of the date this article was written, the author does not own any of the above securities.
summary: Super Micro Computer (SMCI) shares experienced a significant increase, rising 11% in early trading on Tuesday after a previous 11% gain. This surge comes after the stock faced substantial losses during a broader market sell-off influenced by tariffs. Analysts from J.P. Morgan suggested that the company could offset tariff impacts by raising global prices by 4%. The stock's recent volatility is also tied to concerns about a potential Nasdaq delisting, which were alleviated when Supermicro met the filing deadline for delayed financial reports in February. The shares were trading up 6% at around
titles: Watch These Supermicro Price Levels as Stock Soars After Tariff-Induced Selling

title: Smell-seeking drone uses moth antenna to follow a scent
snippets: A moth antenna can be integrated into the electronics of a drone to create a smell-seeking bio-hybrid – but it only detects the smell of a female moth

This innovation marks a unique blend of biological components with technology, though its current application is limited to the identification of one particular smell.
titles: Smell-seeking drone uses moth antenna to follow a scent

This advancement offers a significant tool for early detection and preventive care in expectant mothers.
titles: Blood test predicts preeclampsia risk using RNA

title: How long is a day on Uranus? Slightly longer than we thought, it seems

titles: How long is a day on Uranus? Slightly longer than we thought, it seems

title: Trees capture toxic fingerprint of gold mining in the Amazon
snippets: Mercury pollution accumulating in trees could offer a new way to monitor destructive gold mining operations
summary: Scientists have discovered that mercury pollution, a byproduct of gold mining, is accumulating in trees. This finding offers a novel approach to track and monitor the environmental impact of gold mining operations by analyzing mercury levels in tree tissues.
titles: Trees capture toxic fingerprint of gold mining in the Amazon

title: Experimental medication helps treat cocaine addiction
snippets: A recently developed medication encourages people with cocaine use disorder to reduce their intake of the stimulant – a step towards the first approved drugs to treat the problem
summary: A new medication designed to help individuals with cocaine use disorder has shown promise in encouraging them to lower their cocaine intake. This development represents progress towards potentially the first approved drugs aimed at treating this specific disorder.
titles: Experimental medication helps treat cocaine addiction
